abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            improving agricultural productivity in Azerbaijan.
            Azerbaijan's agriculture was mostly based on small
            family-owned farms that were created as a result of
            privatization of former collective and state farms. Nascent
            private farmers did not have access to inputs for productive
            agricultural production, nor were banks ready to finance
            this risky sector. Agricultural Development and Credit
            project tested a group borrowing scheme under which ten or
            more farmers borrowed together and acted as each
            other’s' guarantor. The loans were small, based on
            market rates, and allowed farmers to buy input seeds and
            other materials for production. Since the beginning of the
            project, thousands of Azerbaijani farmers benefited from the program.
